subhead: The Epstein case, tech billionaires, Venezuela, Israel: The movement that brought Donald Trump back to the White House now finds itself splintered on numerous fronts.  An openly antisemitic, racist and misogynistic current is gaining ground around Nick Fuentes.

Inequality on the rise in France amid a staggering surge in income among the ultrarich
subhead: The wealthiest 0.1% of French people earn, on average, 167 times more than the quarter of households with the lowest incomes, according to France's National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies. The gap has widened dramatically over the past 20 years, while reforms introduced by Emmanuel Macron have reduced the tax rate for the richest households.

title: Dozens killed in Israeli strikes in Gaza
subhead: The strikes on Wednesday were among the deadliest in Gaza since the truce entered into force last month, and came as Israel also announced a string of attacks targeting Hezbollah in Lebanon in spite of a nearly year-long ceasefire there.

title: Fluctuating pay, seasonal work: Welcome to China's 'iPhone City'
subhead: Foxconn's production lines, driven by Apple's marketing strategy, need workers only for part of the year. Still, many are drawn to the overtime pay and bonuses.

title: COP30 overshadowed by trade tensions: 'How to collaborate on decarbonization while protecting economic interests'
subhead: The issue of international trade has taken on unprecedented importance in the global climate negotiations currently underway in Brazil. Disagreements center on the European carbon border adjustment mechanism.

subhead: Our selection of Parisian venues where meat lovers, vegetarians and even vegans can gather around the same table, with inventive dishes crafted to suit everyone.

title: COP30 presents an existential issue for Indigenous peoples
subhead: The global climate conference was meant to be a moment of recognition for Indigenous peoples, who have been placed at the heart of President Lula's political agenda. Yet, faced with the Brazilian president's contradictions, Indigenous activists have come to the fore, determined to make their voices heard at a summit that directly affects them.

title: The mysterious relocation of more than 150 Palestinians from Gaza to South Africa
subhead: Residents of the coastal enclave landed in Johannesburg on Thursday after a journey coordinated by a shadowy humanitarian organization with suspected ties to the Israeli government.
